result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrel Ray Hilsabeck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to sentencing after revocation sentence which has been completed.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay costs of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No contact with any person under the age of 18 without approval from the agent. No use of any computer or electronic equipment without approval from the agent.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample if it has not previously been done.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Darrel Ray Hilsabeck in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Defendant Darrel Ray Hilsabeck in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max penalties, receipt of PSI, recommendation contained therein. Defense advises of correction to PSI. State has no corrections. Discussion regarding statute, max. penalties. State/Defense make sentencing recommendations. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond no longer in effect.
from Defendant questioning what sentence will be

Defendant Darrel Ray Hilsabeck in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Defendant Darrel Ray Hilsabeck in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 2. Count 1 is dismissed but read in for sentencing and/or restitution. Defense requests PSI. Court orders PSI. Bond continues as is.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Darrel Ray Hilsabeck in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Defendant Darrel Ray Hilsabeck in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense thinks case could be resolved within a month, has more to discuss with Defendant.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Change of Attorney

Defendant Darrel Ray Hilsabeck in court with attorney Eric R. Heywood.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Atty Gerbers is assigned to case, is in trial this week, requests rescheduling.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Darrel Ray Hilsabeck in court with attorney Gregory A Gerbers.  Defendant Darrel Ray Hilsabeck in custody.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of transfer of case from Atty Maciolek, advises that offer is pending, requests time to meet with Defendant.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas.
by State

Defendant Darrel Ray Hilsabeck in court with attorney Eric S Maciolek.  Defendant Darrel Ray Hilsabeck in custody.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.  Status conference scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 3/22/14.
Application, Affidavit, Return of Officer, Acknowledgement of Return of Officer

Defendant Darrel Ray Hilsabeck in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek.  Defendant Darrel Ray Hilsabeck in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defense before hearing.  Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim for short time while awaiting offer from State.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 10:30 am.

No contact direct or indirect with any children under age 18 except his own children; or any related children as long as a third party adult is present.

Defendant Darrel Ray Hilsabeck appeared by video conference.  Attorney Eric S. Maciolek appeared by phone.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 3/31/14, 10:00.
